channel.title: Toronto International Film Festival on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Toronto International Film Festival on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: ‘Good Boy’ Review: Stephen Graham and Andrea Riseborough Lead an Intriguingly Odd but Frustratingly Empty Fable
item.description: Premiering at TIFF, the latest from Jan Komasa (‘Corpus Christi’) follows a family man who kidnaps and imprisons a troublemaking stranger, with plans to rehabilitate him.

item.title: ‘Good Boy’ Review: Stephen Graham and Andrea Riseborough Lead an Intriguingly Odd but Frustratingly Empty Fable
item.description: Premiering at TIFF, the latest from Jan Komasa (‘Corpus Christi’) follows a family man who kidnaps and imprisons a troublemaking stranger, with plans to rehabilitate him.

item.title: Havana Rose Liu Had Weeks to Become a Pianist for TIFF Heist Movie ‘Tuner’
item.description: Playing a pianist in Daniel Roher’s musical dramedy meant daily practice for the 27-year-old actress, who once swore off the instrument entirely.

item.title: Havana Rose Liu Had Weeks to Become a Pianist for TIFF Heist Movie ‘Tuner’
item.description: Playing a pianist in Daniel Roher’s musical dramedy meant daily practice for the 27-year-old actress, who once swore off the instrument entirely.

item.title: THR Returns to TIFF With Editorial Portrait Studio and Video Lounge Launching Today
item.description: The content studio, presented by Canada Goose, is being hosted at 1 Hotel Toronto and will feature a star-studded lineup of talent.

item.title: THR Returns to TIFF With Editorial Portrait Studio and Video Lounge Launching Today
item.description: The content studio, presented by Canada Goose, is being hosted at 1 Hotel Toronto and will feature a star-studded lineup of talent.

item.title: Edward Berger on ‘Ballad of a Small Player’, Spritzing Colin Farrell and The Status of His ‘Bourne’ Movie
item.description: Berger’s sweaty noir about lies, loss and lucky gloves debuts at Toronto.

item.title: Edward Berger on ‘Ballad of a Small Player’, Spritzing Colin Farrell and The Status of His ‘Bourne’ Movie
item.description: Berger’s sweaty noir about lies, loss and lucky gloves debuts at Toronto.

item.title: ‘John Candy: I Like Me’ Review: Colin Hanks’ Doc Portrait Pays Poignant Tribute to a Comic Icon’s Life and Legacy
item.description: The TIFF opener features reminiscences by colleagues including Steve Martin, Catherine O’Hara, Dan Aykroyd, Martin Short, Conan O’Brien, Mel Brooks and Tom Hanks.

item.title: ‘John Candy: I Like Me’ Review: Colin Hanks’ Doc Portrait Pays Poignant Tribute to a Comic Icon’s Life and Legacy
item.description: The TIFF opener features reminiscences by colleagues including Steve Martin, Catherine O’Hara, Dan Aykroyd, Martin Short, Conan O’Brien, Mel Brooks and Tom Hanks.

item.title: ‘The Fence’ Review: Matt Dillon Stars in Claire Denis’ Vividly Atmospheric but Jarringly Stagy Africa-Set Drama
item.description: The French auteur’s latest, premiering at TIFF, takes place during one long night on a construction site marked by murder and sexual tension.

item.title: ‘The Fence’ Review: Matt Dillon Stars in Claire Denis’ Vividly Atmospheric but Jarringly Stagy Africa-Set Drama
item.description: The French auteur’s latest, premiering at TIFF, takes place during one long night on a construction site marked by murder and sexual tension.

item.title: ‘Memory of Princess Mumbi’ Director on AI and Writing His African Sci-Fi Romance in Editing Stage
item.description: Damien Hauser discusses his fourth feature, which is hitting Toronto after premiering at Venice, Afrofuturism, ‘Black Panther,’ and the future of AI: “I don’t believe it will replace artists.”

item.title: ‘Memory of Princess Mumbi’ Director on AI and Writing His African Sci-Fi Romance in Editing Stage
item.description: Damien Hauser discusses his fourth feature, which is hitting Toronto after premiering at Venice, Afrofuturism, ‘Black Panther,’ and the future of AI: “I don’t believe it will replace artists.”

item.description: Fala Chen and Tilda Swinton also star in the feature that premieres at TIFF and adapts Lawrence Osborne’s 2014 novel.

item.title: Toronto Film Festival Restores Israel Oct. 7 Doc to 2025 Lineup After Dispute With Filmmakers
item.description: TIFF organizers and ‘The Road Between Us’ producers reached an agreement over “safety, legal and programming concerns” to allow a world premiere for the documentary next month.

item.title: Toronto Film Festival Restores Israel Oct. 7 Doc to 2025 Lineup After Dispute With Filmmakers
item.description: TIFF organizers and ‘The Road Between Us’ producers reached an agreement over “safety, legal and programming concerns” to allow a world premiere for the documentary next month.

item.title: Toronto Film Festival Reconsiders Premiering Israeli Oct. 7 Doc After Pulling Invite
item.description: TIFF CEO Cameron Bailey said he’s “committed to working with the filmmaker to meet TIFF’s screening requirements to allow the film to be screened at this year’s festival.”

item.title: Toronto Film Festival Reconsiders Premiering Israeli Oct. 7 Doc After Pulling Invite
item.description: TIFF CEO Cameron Bailey said he’s “committed to working with the filmmaker to meet TIFF’s screening requirements to allow the film to be screened at this year’s festival.”
